aactivity.TSS:
If "invoke platform-provided functionality" is selected, the evaluator shall examine the
to verify that it describes (for each supported platform) how this functionality is invoked (it should be noted that this may be through a mechanism that is not implemented by the
Server; nonetheless, that mechanism will be identified in the
as part of this evaluation activity).
If "implement functionality" is selected, the evaluator shall examine the
to ensure that it details the self-tests that are run by the
on start-up; this description should include an outline of what the tests are actually doing (e.g., rather than saying "memory is tested", a description similar to "memory is tested by writing a value to each memory location and reading it back to ensure it is identical to what was written" shall be used). The evaluator shall ensure that the
makes an argument that the tests are sufficient to demonstrate that the
is operating correctly.
The evaluator shall examine the
to ensure that it describes how to verify the integrity of stored
executable code when it is loaded for execution. The evaluator shall ensure that the
makes an argument that the tests are sufficient to demonstrate that the integrity of stored
executable code has not been compromised. The evaluator also ensures that the
(or the operational guidance) describes the actions that take place for successful (e.g. hash verified) and unsuccessful e.g., hash not verified) cases.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following tests:
The evaluator performs the integrity check on a known good
executable and verifies that the check is successful.
The evaluator modifies the
executable, performs the integrity check on the modified
executable and verifies that the check fails.
